title: A 200 gm hard water sample is passed through a cation exchanger resin. In which H+ ion is exchanged with Ca2+ ion? The outlet of the water required 50 ml of 0.1 M NaOH for neutralisation. What is the hardness of water? - Quora

response.answer_text: N1 x v1 = n2 x v2 Thus, 0.1 x 50 = n2 x 200 Thus n2 (normality) of hard water is 0.025 Normality x equivalent wt = gms/lt. I. e. 0.025 x 20 (equipment wt of CA) =0.5 g/L or 500 ppm as Ca or 500 x 50/20 = 1250 ppm as CaCO3
